 > Googling the title of your post should be a good start.

   True, but since the question has already been asked...


 >> Also, may I know how to use the following Selenium test scripts
 >> (basic) that I created in JUNIT:

   The test code you included here is in "Selenese", i.e. the test steps 
are written as subsequent rows of an HTML table. If you created the code 
by hand, you'll probably be happy to hear that there's a Firefox plugin 
(Selenium IDE) with which you can easily record such sequences of actions.

   If you already know Selenium IDE, it's time to give Selenium RC a try 
(you'll find an exhaustive documentation at 
http://www.openqa.org/selenium/). With Selenium RC you'll be able to 
programmatically run your tests from the Java (or other language) level. 
Which brings us to the answer to your question - writing in Java and 
using the RC libraries you can organize your Selenium RC tests in the 
JUnit manner.

  This involves converting your HTML test code into Java. In IDE you'll 
there's a useful option "Format -> Java - Selenium RC". Good luck!
